mechanics.condition: Each creature within 10-foot radius sphere centered on chosen point within range
mechanics.outcome: Creature must make a Constitution saving throw

mechanics.condition: Creature succeeds on the saving throw
mechanics.outcome: Creature takes half of 3d8 thunder damage

mechanics.condition: Creature is made of inorganic material (such as stone, crystal, or metal)
mechanics.outcome: Creature has disadvantage on the saving throw

mechanics.condition: Non-magical item is not worn or carried AND within 10-foot radius sphere

description_text: A sudden loud ringing noise, painfully intense, erupts from a point of your choice within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 3d8 thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw. A non-magical item that is not worn or carried also suffers damage if it is in the area of the spell.
